Meet the Experts

Cody Renegar is a celebrity hairstylist who splits his time between Los Angeles, Washington, D.C., and Arkansas.

Flore Des Robert and Pauline Laurent are the founders of La Bonne Brosse.

What factors should you consider when shopping for a boar bristle brushes?

Renegar underscores the need for one with firm bristles that can “properly stimulate the scalp.” Additionally, “you also want to make sure the shape of your brush contours to your head. A nice handle with a good grip is also a plus,” he adds.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

What hair textures should use boar bristle brushes? Are there any that should avoid them?

According to our experts, everyone should be using one—it’s all a matter of technique and frequency of use. “A 100 percent boar bristle hair brush is ideal for normal, fine (even fragile), straight, or soft hair. Used in the morning, the brush regenerates while detangling and styling, while at night, it offers complete care and rids the hair of impurities before bed,” says Flore Des Robert and Pauline Laurent, the founders of La Bonne Brosse. They recommend those with curly or thicker hair use boar bristle brushes in the evening rather than the morning to avoid affecting curl definition and level of volume, depending on the look you’re going for that day.

Renegar also warns that overbrushing damaged or fragile hair can cause further harm. However, you can still reap all the benefits of utilizing a boar bristle brush; just make sure to pay attention to the condition of your strands and don’t overdo it.
